text: Jack White was an Anglican Archdeacon in India in the mid 20th century.Church Appointments. The Times (London, England), Saturday, May 29, 1948; pg. 6; Issue 51084 White trained at Bishop Wilson Theological College, Isle of Man and was ordained in 1927. After curacies at Malew, Rushen and Douglas he went out to India with the Eccles Establishment. He served at Bangalore, Bombay, Trimulgherry, Ootacamund and Madras, where he was Archdeacon from 1944 to 1948.Crockford's Clerical Directory 1963-64 pp1299-1300 ==References== Category:20th-century Anglican priests Category:Alumni of Bishop Wilson Theological College Category:Archdeacons of Madras Category:Eccles Establishment people
title: Jack White (priest)
